Episode II

by Mark Rustad

There is a rule you can apply to most movie trilogies: The second movie in a trilogy is either the best or the worst, never in between. You can debate whether this holds up for other trilogies, but for the Star Wars prequels, it's true: Episode II is clearly the worst of them. In order to further the plot established by the original trilogy and “The Phantom Menace,” there are several key plot points that...
